title: Raikoth: History, Religion
summary:
Key ideas:
- The history of Raikoth, a high-tech society of Latin-speaking Eskimos with a religion based on Greco-Roman philosophy, shamanism, and vision quest volcano prophecies 
- Raikothin religion recognizes two aspects of God: Truth and Beauty
- Humans are the interface points at which the integration of Truth and Beauty takes place 
- Philosophy of the Elith-mirta and Ainai-mirta (Perspective of Truth and Perspective of Beauty) 
- Importance of avoiding heresy by mixing up these perspectives or trying to apply one to the other 

Key learnings:
- Raikothin religion is an attempt to give people a religious and mythological structure within which to view and appreciate human project of art and science, and trying to be happy and virtuous 
- The three great religious institutions of Raikoth: the Priests of Truth, experts at understanding the external world; the Priests of Beauty, experts at understanding the human psyche; and the Priests of Joy, experts at figuring out how to make the two correspond 
- Tolerance and encouragement of superstitions are an important aspect of Raikothin mythology 

Key questions:
- What is the significance of the holy volcano in the Raikothin religion? 
- How does one avoid heresy by maintaining the distinction between the Elith-mirta and Ainai-mirta perspectives? 
- What lessons can be learned from the integration of Truth and Beauty in Raikothin religion and philosophy?
